author: protolambda
content: PSA for testers: it looks like there are 3 test cases in v0.9.3 that ended up without pre-state. I'm still investigating, and looking to fix it before v0.9.4. (which doesn't otherwise change any of the consensus rules, so it should be easy to integrate the tests).

author: protolambda
content: *edit: one of those does have the pre-state, but the involved block accidentally is an unsigned one. Fix to be included in v0.9.4 ðŸ™‚

author: protolambda
content: <@!654267572107083777> You ask and you shall you shall receive, haha. ZRNT release for v0.9.3 is out now, along with ZCLI to v0.0.21.

author: m.kalinin
content: <@203220829473996800> could you please list those tests?

author: protolambda
content: <@!425572898787426305> Oh sorry, forgot, will list them when in a bit

author: m.kalinin
content: thx!

author: protolambda
content:
```
sanity/blocks/pyspec_tests/zero_block_sig
sanity/blocks/pyspec_tests/invalid_block_sig
sanity/blocks/pyspec_tests/invalid_state_root
```
Fixed in PR 1544, to be included in v0.9.4. (no consensus changes there, should be easy to upgrade to). Sorry again, tests were working for pyspec, but we missed some minor test-generation details

author: m.kalinin
content: Thanks <@203220829473996800> That's a good to know! As I am currently updating community tests.
